---
name: backend-models
description: Define Django models with proper field types, relationships, Meta options, and custom managers following project conventions. Use this skill when creating or modifying Django models, defining ForeignKey/ManyToMany relationships, implementing model methods like __str__ or clean, creating TextChoices/IntegerChoices enums, writing custom QuerySets or Managers, adding database constraints or indexes, or working on files named models.py or managers.py.
---

## When to use this skill:

- When creating new Django model classes
- When adding fields to existing models
- When defining ForeignKey, OneToOneField, or ManyToManyField relationships
- When implementing model methods like __str__, get_absolute_url, or clean
- When creating TextChoices or IntegerChoices for field options
- When writing custom Manager or QuerySet classes
- When adding Meta options like ordering, constraints, or indexes
- When creating abstract base models for shared functionality
- When defining field validators or database-level constraints
- When working on files named models.py or managers.py
- When setting up related_name for reverse relationships
- When implementing soft delete or timestamp patterns

# Backend Models

This Skill provides Claude Code with specific guidance on how to adhere to coding standards as they relate to how it should handle backend models.

## Instructions

For details, refer to the information provided in this file:
